lead_paragraph: Italy won its first Fed Cup title yesterday, beating Belgium, 3-2, after Justine Henin-Hardenne was forced to retire because of searing knee pain during the deciding doubles match at Charleroi, Belgium. Henin-Hardenne, the runner-up at the United States Open and the French Open champion, won both her singles matches during the weekend despite assorted health problems. She abandoned the final during the third set of doubles. The Italian duo of Francesca Schiavone and Roberta Vinci defeated Henin-Hardenne and Kirsten Flipkens, 3-6, 6-2, 2-0.
